People with poor vision could use other assistive technology such as magnifying glasses, reading lamps, or magnification devices to help them read and see things more clearly.
They could also use audio technology to help them navigate and perform daily tasks.
People could use their sense of touch to feel their way around their environment and perform tasks such as cooking and cleaning.
They could use their sense of smell to identify objects and people in their environment.
They could use their sense of hearing to communicate with others and navigate their environment.
